title: Pain Assessment CRUD Controller
description:
Implement Pain Assessment Controller with Multi-Scale Support

Create a backend controller that manages pain assessment data with support for multiple standardized pain measurement scales and provides comprehensive CRUD operations.

Requirements:
- Support multiple pain assessment scales (e.g., Visual Analog Scale, Numeric Rating Scale, Wong-Baker FACES, FLACC)
- Implement RESTful endpoints for creating, reading, updating, and deleting pain assessments
- Associate assessments with specific patients and timestamps
- Validate assessment data according to each scale's specific constraints (e.g., 0-10 range for NRS)
- Store assessment metadata including assessor identity, assessment date/time, and patient context
- Handle retrieval of assessment history with filtering by date range, patient, and scale type
- Return appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages for validation failures
- Ensure data persistence through appropriate database models/repositories
- Add input sanitization and validation middleware
- Include proper error handling for edge cases (invalid scale type, missing patient ID, malformed data)

Technical Considerations:
- Define clear data models/schemas for each assessment scale
- Use appropriate validation libraries for input checking
- Consider pagination for historical assessment queries
- Implement proper authentication/authorization checks to ensure assessors can only access appropriate patient data
- Add logging for audit trail purposes

Success Criteria:
- All CRUD operations work correctly for each supported assessment scale
- Invalid inputs are rejected with clear error messages
- Assessment history can be retrieved and filtered efficiently
- Data integrity is maintained across all operations
